update.description:
- Implement bullet contact feedback, issue #523,
- Change ODE force torque feedback values from world to link frame #545
- Add 2 contact sensor tests

Contact positions and normals are still in world frame, changing them breaks contact visualization. Will tackle that next.

Update: Add collision ptrs in Contact class to remove GetByName calls
update.title: Bullet contact sensor

content.raw: added collision pointers to Contact class. I had to add world name to contact.proto so that in the `operator =(const msgs::Contact &_contact)` function I can then get the pointers back from collision names.
content.html: added collision pointers to Contact class. I had to add world name to contact.proto so that in the operator =(const msgs::Contact &_contact) function I can then get the pointers back from collision names.

content.raw: InternalTickCallback is called by the end of bullet's stepSimulation in BulletPhysics::UpdatePhysics which happens in a World::Update. Model creation and deletion occur in sequential to World::Update so the number of manifolds should not change during the execution of this function.
content.html: InternalTickCallback is called by the end of bullet's stepSimulation in BulletPhysics::UpdatePhysics which happens in a World::Update. Model creation and deletion occur in sequential to World::Update so the number of manifolds should not change during the execution of this function.

content.raw: GetByName is very expensive. Can you make this change now?
content.html: GetByName is very expensive. Can you make this change now?

content.raw: Can the number of manifolds change? For example, if new objects are added or removed from the world during this function call. If so, then we need a mutex (unless there is already a mutex protecting this function at a higher level).
content.html: Can the number of manifolds change? For example, if new objects are added or removed from the world during this function call. If so, then we need a mutex (unless there is already a mutex protecting this function at a higher level).
done, and ticketed issue #565

content.raw: ok thanks. I will take out the check for physics engine and file an issue on this. Once we start tuning bullet params we'll be able to make the behavior more consistent
content.html: ok thanks. I will take out the check for physics engine and file an issue on this. Once we start tuning bullet params we'll be able to make the behavior more consistent

content.raw: I think in this case the regression tests in this pull request is mainly targeted at a new feature (issue #523) rather than fixing something so it's ok to leave out the issue number in the code. On the other hand issue #545 changes the expected output of a component in the system, so I will put a comment with the issue number in the relevant part of the test code.
content.html: I think in this case the regression tests in this pull request is mainly targeted at a new feature (issue #523) rather than fixing something so it's ok to leave out the issue number in the code. On the other hand issue #545 changes the expected output of a component in the system, so I will put a comment with the issue number in the relevant part of the test code.

content.raw: We still don't have a clear policy about regression tests. About what should go into {source}/{file}_TEST.cc I have a clear idea that should be unit testing. Remember that unit testing should not depend on any other project class or external dependency, only class code should be tested. Seen this case looks more like an regression test in the scope of integration or system than something related to unit testing. Until proper policy arrives to regression, I would recommend to make a comment into the file name or inside own test (a comment?) about what ticket it fixed.
content.html: We still don't have a clear policy about regression tests. About what should go into {source}/{file}_TEST.cc I have a clear idea that should be unit testing. Remember that unit testing should not depend on any other project class or external dependency, only class code should be tested. Seen this case looks more like an regression test in the scope of integration or system than something related to unit testing. Until proper policy arrives to regression, I would recommend to make a comment into the file name or inside own test (a comment?) about what ticket it fixed.

content.raw:
I'd prefer that we use the same EXPECT tests for each physics engine. We could put custom tests into the unit tests inside `gazebo/physics/ode` or `gazebo/physics/bullet`, but I think the higher-level gazebo tests shouldn't change the test based on the physics engine. If there is different behavior between physics engines, we should file an issue on that.

I'll look more into the specifics of why the behavior is different in this case and suggest a change to the test.
content.html:
I'd prefer that we use the same EXPECT tests for each physics engine. We could put custom tests into the unit tests inside gazebo/physics/ode or gazebo/physics/bullet, but I think the higher-level gazebo tests shouldn't change the test based on the physics engine. If there is different behavior between physics engines, we should file an issue on that.

I'll look more into the specifics of why the behavior is different in this case and suggest a change to the test.

content.raw:
All the other spawn functions are written this way, but I think the math::Vector3's have stream operators, so this could be:

`<< "<pose>" << pos << ' ' << rpy << "</pose>"`
content.html:
All the other spawn functions are written this way, but I think the math::Vector3's have stream operators, so this could be:

<< "<pose>" << pos << ' ' << rpy << "</pose>"

content.raw: @_jrivero_ This pull request adds a regression test for the contact sensor. Should we put it in the `test/regression` folder, or should we put it in `gazebo/sensors/ContactSensor_TEST`?
content.html: @jrivero This pull request adds a regression test for the contact sensor. Should we put it in the test/regression folder, or should we put it in gazebo/sensors/ContactSensor_TEST?
